instructions.title: Install Dependencies
instructions.description:
In your project root, run npm install --save react-redux 
npm install —save redux 
npm install —save redux-thunk

instructions.title: Create Folder Structure
instructions.description: In your project root create an 'app' folder. In the app folder create an 'actions' folder , a 'reducers' folder and a 'components' folder.

instructions.title: Create your first action
instructions.description:
The action is a basic function called from the component whenever we want the whole state of the app to be changed. Our action creator is a simple function returning an object (the action itself)with a type attribute expressing what happened with the app.
In your actions folder create a js file 'index.js'

instructions.title: Create your first reducer
instructions.description:
Reducers are the ones in charge of updating the state of the app. Redux will automatically pass the current state of the app and the action occurred. It’s up to the reducer to realize if it needs to modify the state or not based on the action.type.
In your reducers folder create a js file 'index.js'

instructions.title: Create your component
instructions.description: In your components folder create a js file 'home.js'

instructions.title: Create Store
instructions.description: In the app folder, create a js file 'store.js'

instructions.title: Link it all together
instructions.description: Redux needs to inject a store holding the app state into the app. To do so, it requires a ‘Provider’ wrapping the whole app.In the app folder, create a js file 'setup.js'
